section.title: Releases
section.p: For all releases prior to 0.9.6, the release notes can be found here.

release.description: Bug fixes in Castor JDO, XML.

summary.p: This is the final 0.9.6. release. We are currently planning the next milestone release which will be Castor 1.0.
- Creating Custom FieldHandlers
Final release. Since the third release candidate, the following problem areas have been addressed.

bug.description: Fixed problem with TransactionContext.getObjectEntry(Object) that was introduced as a result of adding support for lazy loading 1:1 relations.
Added F.A.Q. entry describing compatibility problems between various releases of mySQL 4.1.x and its JDBC drivers.
Reverted various DOCTYPE definitions in src/tests/jdo to use DTDs.

Fixed issue with GeneralizedFieldHandler not able to handle collections. Collections are now automatically iterated over during getValue() calls and each item in the collection is passed into the convertUponGet method. To retain the old behavior simply add a call to #setCollectionIteration with a value of false in the constructor of your GeneralizedFieldHandler. The behavior for setter methods is not changed since only one item at a time is passed into the setter already.

Fixed whitespace processing bug, where a ' ' was actually getting appended to the end of a string value if the parser was calling the #characters method again with only whitespace following a previous call to #characters method where valid content existed.
Fixed recent issue where ElementDecl#getType() method was always returning null for element references.

release.description: Bug fixes in Castor JDO, XML

summary.p: Preparations for the final release have started. Since the second release candidate, the following problem areas have been addressed.

bug.description: Added getCacheManager() method in Database interface
Fixed problem with loading mappings with relative path
Mapping.loadMapping(String) duplicates directory path. Fixed problem by making the given url a relative URL so that the document base isn't duplicated.
Fixed various problems that prevented compilation under JDK 1.3.
Fixed syntax error in src/tests/jdo/mysql.sql.
Improved exception handling during TransactionContext instantiation.
Changed attribute type for 'name' attribute on key-generator element definition in mapping.dtd.
Overloaded jdo.Size with Oracle-specific test case.
Various problems with classloader usage.
SimleQueryExecutor and data visibility issues
Added some additional support for nillable fields. There is still some more work needed in this area, but this gets us closer.
Added initial support to suppress namespaces during Marshalling. This has been a long asked for feature, so I figured it was about time I finally got around to doing this.

release.description: Mainly bug fixes, but also minor enhancements in Castor JDO.

summary.p: There's an issue with Castor finding mapping files within JARs when the path to the mapping file is specified relatively to the JDO configuration file. We are working on this, but as there's a workaround (using InputSources as mentioned on the mailing lists recently), we have decided to go ahead and not hold back this second release candidate. Details on this bug can be found here.
Since the first release candidate, the following problem areas have been addressed.

bug.description: Fixed NullPointerException thrown during Castor Validation
Added support for lazy-loading simple 1:1 relations
Status property of Castor's TransactionContext not set correctly in global transactions.
Castor JDO test suite now uses log level "error" by default.
Fixed problem in CastorException? (String, Throwable) where the constructor of the superclass was not called.
Fixed problem with resetting the capacity of CountLimited? cache.
Fixed problem with "sqltime" field type where it was incorrectly mapped to java.sql.Date rather than java.sql.Time.
Added additional debug statements during binding of SQL parameters.
Adds configuration of JDO using an inline JDBC DataSource by providing configuration parameters using a Properties collection.
Fixed problem using JDOConfFactory with JDBC DataSources.
Added support for using constants in comparison expressions with bind values.
Handling of SQL parameter binding and their order is now completely handled by SqlBindParser.
Added support for SQL parameters as part of IN statements in WHERE clauses.

release.description: Mainly bug fixes, but also contains enhancements in Castor JDO, XML.

summary.p: Please note that we are providing the usual suspect (binaries, docs and sources) for this release at the Exolab FTP server. We recommend, though, to download the complete package, as the HTML docs at the main Castor site have not been updated, and build the documentation yourself.
summary.h3: Format of the JDO configuration file
summary.p: Due to various internal refactorings, we decide to change the syntax of the JDO configuration file, adding a new root element named <jdo-conf> and elements to declare transaction demarcation semantics. Here's a sample of Castor JDO running against mySQL (with local transactions).
summary.code:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <!DOCTYPE jdo-conf PUBLIC "-//EXOLAB/Castor JDO Configuration DTD Version 1.0//EN" "http://castor.exolab.org/jdo-conf.dtd">
<jdo-conf> <database name="test" engine="mysql" > <driver url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/test" class-name="org.gjt.mm.mysql.Driver"> <param name="user" value="test" /> <param name="password" value="test" /> </driver> <mapping href="mapping.xml" /> </database> <transaction-demarcation mode="local" /> </jdo-conf>
summary.p: When setting up JDBC DataSources to be used with Castor JDO, configuration of parameters now needs to occur as a sequence of <param> elements rather than one <params> element. This is to stream-line the way these JDBC resources are configured.
What used to be
before this release, now needs to be specifed as follows:
summary.code: <data-source class-name="com.sybase.jdbc2.jdbc.SybDataSource"> <param name="user" value="thomas" /> <param name="password" value="thomas" /> <param name="port-number" value="2048" /> <param name="server-name" value="Dual1" /> <param name="database-name" value="thomas" /> </data-source>
summary.p: Please note the use of hyphens in the naming of properties. In other words, in order for Castor to set the value of the portNumber property of the SybDataSource to '2048', please use the following <param> element
rather than
as shown in the pooling documentation for previous releases.

A new way of configuring transaction demarcation has been added. This configuration is now part of the main JDO configuration file (jdo-conf) and mandates the specification of the transaction demarcation used within your application.

As part of this configuration file, the user has to specify which transaction demarcation to use. This can either be 'local' or 'global', and is supplied by the use of a <transaction-demarcation> element.

In this mode, the XML element <transaction-manager> specifies the transaction manager that is used by your application server/web container to control these transactions.

summary.h3: Using timezone information when accessing date/time/timestamp data
summary.p: Castor will use the JDBC ResultSet.getDate(int, Calendar) and related methods which take a Calendar object to specify the timezone of the data retrieved from the database when the timezone information is not already specified in the data; this ensures that the 'current' timezone is applied.

The default time zone can be configured in the castor.properties file; see the configuration section for details on how to configure Castor with information about your default time zone. To change the timezone to a different timezone than the default, please set a (different) value on the org.exolab.castor.jdo.defaultTimeZone property:
summary.code: # Default time zone to apply to dates/times fetched from database fields, # if not already part of the data. Specify same format as in # java.util.TimeZone.getTimeZone, or an empty string to use the computer's # local time zone. # org.exolab.castor.jdo.defaultTimeZone= org.exolab.castor.jdo.defaultTimeZone=GMT+8:00
summary.h3: JDO configuration without a file and JDoConfFactory
summary.p: As part of this release, we have added a way to configure Castor JDO without the need to provide an XML configuration file. As such,
has been provided to pass in an instance of JdoConf. Too assist users of this new approach in creating JdoConf instances, please have a look at org.exolab.castor.jdo.util.JdoConfFactory.

In order to clear all previously registered Castor Database configurations you can now call the new function org.exolab.castor.jdo.engine.DatabaseRegistry.clear(). This is for example usefull, if you want to log on using a user supplied login name and database connection. It is especially needed if it's possible to change the login password of the database login account in interactive applications.

With this release, we have decided to remove several methods related to clearing caches (partially) from Database(impl).java. Instead, we have created a new CacheManager class in the util package that can be obtained from a Database instance as follows:
summary.code: Database db = jdo.getDatabase(); CacheManager manager = db.getCacheManager();
summary.p: Once such an instance has been obtained, cache content can be cleared (partially) using one of several CacheManager?.clearCache() methods. In addition, users might inquire about whether an object is currently cached (or not) by using CacheManager.isCached (Class, Object).
Details about the functionality provided by this new class can be found in the HTML docs and/or Javadocs.
On a selected number of RDBMS, Castor JDO now supports the use of LIMIT (and OFFSET clauses) as follows:
This will select accounts 6 to 15, given that numbers for account ids start at 1.
As per this release, the following RDBMS have full/partial support for this new feature.
1) Oracle has full support for LIMIT/OFFSET clauses for release 8.1.6 and later.
summary.h3: OQL - bind variables in combination with "IN" operators
summary.p: Previously it was only possible to use OQL WHERE statements with "IN" operators of the following form:
summary.code: "... WHERE DNAME in list(1, 2, 3)" "... WHERE DNAME in list(\"SALES\", \"TEST\", \"ABC\")" "... WHERE DNAME in list(\"ABC\", nil)"

If you are not satisfied with Castor's set of performance caches, we've added a way for you to provide you own cache implementationa and register it with Castor.
To provide a custom cache implementation, you need to

ol.li: Create a class that implements org.exolab.castor.persist.cache.Cache (we have provided an abstract base class that you can use at your convenience).
Create a class that implements org.exolab.castor.persist.cache.CacheFactory (we have provided an abstract base class that you can use at your convenience).
Register your custom cache implementation with Castor JDO in the castor.properties file.

summary.p: Detailed instructions can be found in the package.html file of the org.exolab.castor.persist.cache package.
The Castor Source Generator Ant Task has been added to the CVS tree. Below is an example of how to use it from within an Ant build descriptor:
summary.code:
<target name="castor:gen:src" depends="init" description="Generate Java source files from XSD.">
<taskdef name="castor-srcgen" classname="org.exolab.castor.tools.ant.taskdefs.CastorSourceGenTask" classpathref="castor.class.path" /> <mkdir dir="${gen.src.d}" /> <castor-srcgen file="${schema.d}/books2.xsd" todir="${gen.src.d}" package="com.sourcebeat.castorlive.xmodel" types="j2" warnings="false" /> </target>
summary.p: The only requirement is that the castor-srcgen-ant-task.jar must be on the CLASSPATH.

To provide backwards-compatibility, we have created a new JDO2 class and left the old untouched.

bug.description: Added support for namespace to package mappings on the Unmarshaller and UnmarshalHandler. This basically fixes issues where Castor can't find the right package to look for classes during unmarshalling. This is main for those people using generated source code, as using a mapping file you must specify the packages and namespaces appropriately.
Fixed bug in SourceGenerator where class names for SimpleType instances with Enumeration facets were not getting resolved properly.
Added additional debug statements during binding of SQL parameters.
Added a new isCached() method to CacheManager.
Castor JDO now uses timezone information when reading date/timestamp/time data from the RDBMS.
Updated src/tests/jdo/oracle.xml and src/tests/jdo/postgresql.xml to be in-line with new grammar.
Extends new SQL parameter binding code to SimpleQueryExecutor.
Improved exception handling in the persist.cache package, by ensuring proper exception chaining.
Brought configuration of <data-source> in line with <driver>, switching from <params> to a sequence of <param> elements.
Added the Castor Ant Task and an Ant target to the build jar.
Added core/** package and children to castor-xml.jar.
Brought jdo-conf.dtd in-line with XML Schema instance, making <transaction-demarcation> required.
Fixed StackOverflowError that was occuring at certain times during container processing if the input XML was invalid.
Added new (experimental) JDO2.java, adding factory method for instantiation, removing public constructor, changing way of loading configuration.
DecimalValidator was not taking into account a leading sign ('+' or '-').
Fixed problem with finding add<FieldName>() method.
Framed <driver>, <data-source> and <jndi> elements in jdo-conf.xsd with an <xsd:choice> to indicate that at any time only one should be present.
Re-enabled support for LIMIT clauses for MS SQL Server.
Changed Log4J configuration to use XML file (log4j.xml).
Initial support for xsi:nil. xsi:nil support is not complete with these patches, but it was worth checking them in as it gets us closer to completion.
UnmarshalState._markedList Vector is a performance bottleneck, replaced by a by HashSet.
Fixed Whitepspace handling where whitespace was not preserved for container objects.
Whilespace was not getting preserved correctly during unmarshalling when parser splits up calls to the UnmarshalHandler#characters method.
Updated the Marshaller to use ContentHandler directly instead of wrapping in a ParserAdapter. Users Marshalling to a ContentHandler should see a significant speed up when Marshalling.

Fixed a bug in the Marshaller with the xsi:type logic not being strict enough. Sometimes the Marshaller was not adding xsi:type when it was needed. I've modified this logic a bit to make it output xsi:type more often in order to preserve round tripping.
Added DB2-specifc support for the OQL LIMIT clause.
In the case a RDBMS does not support the LIMIT/OFFSET clauses, a SyntaxNotSupportedException is thrown.
Added the ability to specify an OFFSET clause with LIMIT clauses. This patch provides support for postgreSQL, mySQL and HSQL only.
Added example to src/examples/MappingTool to demonstrate the use of the MappingTool.
Improved exception handling for the transactionmanager package.
Added XML prefixes to various files in src/examples and src/tests/jdo.
Added code to handle extend relationships where no additional fields are added. For such cases, no STORE SQL statement will be generated (and used).
Upgraded JUnit to version 3.8.1.
Added code to allow users to use their own cache implementation with Castor. In general, available cache implementations are now specified in castor.properties.
Reworked the mailing list guidelines. Added various sections re: cross-posting, etc.
Introduces various checks and additional exception handling wrt to using TimeStampables.
Added separate build folders for src/tests and src/examples to the Eclipse project files.
Updated Eclipse related project files.
Added support for LIMIT/OFFSET clauses for HSQL, and extended HSQL-specific test case.
Added support for registering TxSynchronizable instances via castor.properties.
Added a new converter boolean(true)->numeric(-1) to cover MS Access' way of storing boolean values.
Added Castor JDO test TC20b to mySQL and sapdb categoeries (incl. additions to the SQL DDL).
Added support for RDBMS-specific meta data in general. This is currently used within OracleQueryExpression to support the LIMIT clause implementation for Oracle 8.1.6 and above only.
Added support for LIMIT/OFFSET clauses for Oracle, and fixed problems with mySQL implementation (ordering of parameters).
Added code to support is<FieldName>() methods for boolean properties in addition to standard getter.
Improved debug statements during create operations, showing the actual SQL generated with values bound.
Fixed problem in FieldMolder when dealing with addXXX() methods on fields of type collection.
FieldMolder now looks for is<FieldName>() methods for boolean properties, in addition to standard get<FieldName>() methods.
Fixed problem with loading classes (resulting in IllegalArgumentException) by properly handling ClassNotFoundExceptions.
Added functionality to clear/reset the database configuration. Added functionality to configure Castor JDO via an in-memory JDOConf instance (plus a factory class for creating JdoConf instances).
Fixed problem using the HighLowKeyGenerator with the same-connection attribute set to 'true'.
Provided a patch to initialize array(s) with the correct size, rather than hardcoding the value '10'.
Fixed problem with delayed removal of cache entries when deleting objects.
Added clearCache() method to CastorTestCase, and fixed a problem in test data setup in src/tests/jdo/OqlExtends.java
Added CacheManager (and DatabaseImpl.getCacheManager() method) to allow users to selectively flush the Castor performance cache(s).
Moved CastorException to org.exolab.castore.core.exceptions. In addition, PersistenceException now derives from CastorException.
Fixed NPE in SQL CALL statements with master/detail relation.
Updated list of available mapping types.
Added (general JDO) Utils class.
Fixed various small problems with SQL DDLs in src/tests/jdo.
Refactored code, applying strategy pattern.

Fixes a memory leak with the linked-list implementation by removing LinkedList completely; uses the Hashtable directly, resulting in much better performance. ValuesEnumeration no longer use a Vector, but intercepts the initial enumeration to provide the values.
This improves code quality for the complete jdo package (except conf.*) by removing unused import statements and local variables.
Added log statement to identfy problems with missing collection.
Brought test setup for SAP DB in-line with test requirements.
Brought test config file for SAP DB in-line with XML Schema.
Added test for IdentityKeyGenerator to SAP DB test suite.
Fixed problem with incorrectly quoting non-function names for SAP DB.
Added support for SAB DB to IdentityKeyGenerator.
Fixed various problems related to the setup of JDO test data with SAP DB.
Fixed problem with 'select count(*) ...' statement with HSQL.
Added new TransactionManagerFactory for IBM WebSphere 5.1.
Added code to extend the message generated for ObjectModifiedExceptions.
Fixed a problem with class loading in various places of ParamInfo by passing a ClassLoader instance during instantiation.
Fixed an incorrectly coded equality check related to global transaction demarcation.
Small (mostly syntactical) changes to src/doc/jdo-faq.xml. Added a reference to XPath as well.
Fixed default namespace declaration, changed some small syntax issues.
Fixed a typo in a debug statement (wrong message resource key used).
Added code to support org.exolab.castor.types.Duration as a native type in Castor JDO. Added convertors for type conversion org.exolab.castor.types.Duration <-> java.lang.Long.
Streamlines Eclipse related project files.
Added many enhancements to the tx mgr API including code improvements, jdo-conf.xsd changes, dynamic code generation using Castor XML as well as a refactored Ant build descriptor.
DuplicateIdentityExceptions not reported correctly when using PostgreSQL.
